page.title: 11 Life on Strelley Estate
page.content: An owner-occupier on the council estate says: "When I was little, before all these houses were built, it used to be all humps and hollows where you could play marbles and hide and seek and ride on go carts. But now it is built up I don't think that the children at this end of the estate have got anywhere where they can play games like football without being told off all the time. When I was young we used to go up to {Strelley Village}a lot and there used to be sand banks where we used to ride on our go carts and we used to make caves in the humps and hollows. But now the sand banks have been flattened down by the motorway.{Strelley Estate has deteriorated a lot over the years. Now there's a lot of vandalism especially near the shops."
